author: abdel.stark
content: The initial gas limit is too high

author: abdel.stark
content: We will never reach a reasonable gas limit

author: abdel.stark
content: However i am wondering if this is important for what we want to test

author: abdel.stark
content: I mean as long as we are able to process 20M+ gas blocks we are good, right ? No matter if this represent only 0.0000000000001% of the block gas limit

author: abdel.stark
content: <@!552133098075193354> <@!301186049323958275> <@!273808422753796097> Do you think this is bad or we can do the performance tests on this network ? Otherwise I can deploy a new testnet but it will take ~2 weeks to build a state comparable to mainnet ?

author: abdel.stark
content: We plan to pay the basefee whatever the value is when we build big blocks. So IMO it does not really matter to have a realistic base fee value and block maximum size as long as we fill with 20M gas (and more) blocks

author: timbeiko
content: I think it's fine to do the tests on the network with the large gas limit: we already have the PoA network to test that the base fee change works well. Curious what others think here too. I'd rather not push things back another couple weeks.
